title: Labor Board Classifies ‘Love Is Blind’ Contestants As Employees
description: The National Labor Relations Board issued a complaint against the hit reality show Love Is Blind in which it classified the show’s contestants as employees, opening a case that could have ripple effects across the reality television industry. What do you think? The post Labor Board Classifies ‘Love Is Blind’ Contestants As Employees appeared first on The Onion.
author: The Onion Staff
excerpt: The National Labor Relations Board issued a complaint against the hit reality show Love Is Blind in which it classified the show’s contestants as employees, opening a case that could have ripple effects across the reality television industry. What do you think?
text: The National Labor Relations Board issued a complaint against the hit reality show Love Is Blind in which it classified the show’s contestants as employees, opening a case that could have ripple effects across the reality television industry. What do you think? “So I should put ‘dating’ on my resume?” Steven Delaney, Commerce Enthusiast “As long as we can all agree the cast of The Circle are nothing more than meat.” Angela Messick, Livestock Barterer “Dating your coworkers is totally inappropriate.” Paul Werk, Cliff Smoother
html:
The National Labor Relations Board issued a complaint against the hit reality show Love Is Blind in which it classified the show’s contestants as employees, opening a case that could have ripple effects across the reality television industry. What do you think?

“So I should put ‘dating’ on my resume?”

Steven Delaney, Commerce Enthusiast

“As long as we can all agree the cast of The Circle are nothing more than meat.”

Angela Messick, Livestock Barterer

“Dating your coworkers is totally inappropriate.”

Paul Werk, Cliff Smoother
